Description: The Long Patrol: Nightfall; open camp-site, figure squatting beside fire, and another standing near camel beyond, other camels lying down. July 13, 1917 Pen and black ink and watercolour
Curator's comments: This watercolour is one of 'The Long Patrol' series that James McBey drew in July 1917 when he accompanied, in his capacity as Official War Artist in Egypt, an Imperial Camel Corps Patrol through the desert of Sinai (for more information see Curator's comment 1919,0412.23).
Exhibition history: 1918 Jan-Feb, London, Colnaghi & Obach, Drawings in Egypt and Palestine by Lieutenant James McBey, Official Artist with the Egyptian Expeditionary Force, cat. 1
Acquisition name: Donated by: Government of United Kingdom
